stimulusHtml:
Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.


A sociologist is interested in examining the sleep habits of United States teenagers. The sociologist posted an online poll on social media that asked teenagers to respond to the question, “Do you usually sleep at least seven hours per day?”

(a) Explain how the sociologist’s sampling method might have introduced bias and describe how the bias might affect the point estimate of p, the proportion of all United States teenagers who would respond “yes” to the question.

Suppose that 67% of United States teenagers sleep at least seven hours per day. Let K represent the number of teenagers in a random sample of eight teenagers from the United States who sleep at least seven hours per day. The graph shows the probability distribution of K.

(b) Calculate and interpret the expected value of K.
(c) Describe a simulation process that could be conducted to estimate the value of P(4≤K≤7).

A student at a high school in the United States is interested in examining whether the 2,400 teenagers at the school have different sleep habits from the population of United States teenagers. A random sample of 40 teenagers will be selected from the school and each teenager will be asked to report whether they usually sleep at least seven hours per day.

(d) If the student uses a stratified random sampling procedure to select the sample, identify an effective variable on which to stratify. Explain your reasoning.

Assume the conditions for inference are met. A 95 percent confidence interval for the proportion of all teenagers at this school who would report that they usually sleep at least seven hours per day was computed to be 0.725±0.138.

(e) Does the confidence interval provide convincing statistical evidence that students at this high school have different sleep habits from the population of United States teenagers? Justify your answer.
